result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael David Cowart Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Michael David Cowart Jr was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Michael David Cowart Jr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to Modify Report date filed by Atty. Masana
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment.

Defendant Michael David Cowart Jr in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed.  Plea of no contest  to count 1, 3 & 4.  Court adjudged guilty of these 3 counts and enters JOC.  Count 2 and 5 dismissed.  Court imposes on Count 1: s/w/h 3 years probation with conds of 6 months jail with huber consecutive to count 4, $2198.00, 36 month revocation & IID upon licensure, AODA, and treatment,  not poss/cons alcohol.  DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge.  On count 3: costs of $443.00.  On count 4:  6 months jail with huber, costs of $443.00.  Jail to begin May 1, 2015 at 7:00 pm.   0 days jail credit.  Good time on both jail sentences.  Transfer to Marathon County.  Fines on the non probation cases due 60 days or pay plan.  Fine on probation case to be paid as condition of probation.

Agreement reached.  State requests a bench warrant and stay for a week and a day.  Atty Masana to find a date that works and talk with ADA Cross and contact JA for a date.  Court states that date needs to be in clients hands by March 24th otherwise warrant will be done.  9:00 am.
